chapter.para: Administration > System > Identity > Person > Person Lookup > Person
The Group document allows you to associate persons, roles or other groups with each other in order to assign the same role to all group members.
Groups have no inherent permissions or responsibilities of their own. Only by associating a group with a role do the members of that group become associated with permissions and responsibilities.

sect1.title: Document Layout
sect1.para: The Group document includes Document Overview, Overview, Attributes and Assignees tabs.

sect1.title: Overview Tab
sect1.para: This tab identifies the group with a unique system-assigned ID number, a namespace and a name. Each group also has a type that specifies any qualifiers that this group might require.

tr.td: Display-only. The unique system-assigned ID number that identifies this group. The system completes this field when you submit the document.

td.para: Required. The type of attributes that will be associated with this group. Some group types, such as the Default Type, require no attributes to be collected.
When creating a new group, you must select the Type before the system can generate the document.

tr.td: Required. An indicator that associates the group with a particular application and module.
Required. The common descriptive name by which this group is known.

Check this box to indicate that this Group is active and is a valid choice for assigning to roles. Uncheck the box to indicate that this group is inactive (no longer valid when making role assignments).

sect2.title: Creating New Groups
sect2.para: When you click the Create New button the system displays the KIM Type Lookup screen. You must search for and select an existing Type in order for the system to generate a new Group document.
This lookup is used whenever you create a new group or role. The search attributes are explained below.

tr.td: Optional. Select the code identifying the application and module this KIM type pertains to.
Optional. Enter the name identifying this KIM type.
Optional. Enter the unique system-assigned identifying number for this KIM type.
Required (defaults to 'Yes'). Change the default selection to view KIM types that are inactive or are both active and inactive.

sect2.para: The display of search results includes the same fields as the Lookup screen. To select the type you want to use for your new group, click the return value link for it.

sect1.title: Attributes Tab
sect1.para: This tab contains any attributes specific to this group's type. For example, if a group has a type of Chart and Organization, this tab will record the Chart and Organization values that are specific to this group. In the example below a Chart Code and Organization Code are required for establishing groups of this type.

sect1.title: Assignees Tab
sect1.para: This tab contains the members who belong to this group. It can also be used to add new members or edit the values associated with existing members.

tr.td: Required. Select the type of member you are adding to this group. Group members can be principals (as defined on the Person document), roles or other groups.

Required. Enter the ID that identifies the member you are adding or use the lookupÂ to search for and select a valid Member ID. The lookup directs you to the Principal, Group or Role lookup based on your Member Type Code selection.
Display only. Displays the name of the member you've selected.
Optional. To specify the earliest date on which this member is to be considered a valid member of this group, enter a From Date.

td.para: Optional. To specify a date on which this member is no longer to be considered a valid member of this group, enter a To Date.
Note that you cannot delete or inactivate group members. To remove a member from a group enter an Active To Date.

tr.td: Click the Add button to add this member to the group.
